## registry.register() function

Registers a class based on a type and name.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function register<T>(type: string | Type<T>, name: string, registryItem: (new (...p1: any[]) => T) | null | any, opt_allowOverrides?: boolean): void;
```

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

type


</td><td>

string \| [Type](./blockly.registry_namespace.type_class.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;


</td><td>

The type of the plugin. (e.g. Field, Renderer)


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

name


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

The plugin's name. (Ex. field\_angle, geras)


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

registryItem


</td><td>

(new (...p1: any\[\]) =&gt; T) \| null \| any


</td><td>

The class or object to register.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

opt\_allowOverrides


</td><td>

boolean


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ True to prevent an error when overriding an already registered item.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

void

## Exceptions

{<!-- -->Error<!-- -->} if the type or name is empty, a name with the given type has already been registered, or if the given class or object is not valid for its type.
